intro: Crepis linifolia, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Crepis linifolia is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
